newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana Bourse recovers from Wednesday's fall.
newsitem.headline: Ghana Bourse recovers from Wednesday's fall.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange rose slightly on Friday, with a moderate improvement in volume after a sharp fall on Wednesday.
The All-share index rose 2.14 points to close at 384.63, up from 382.49 on Wednesday. Total turnover rose to 42,140 shares from 18,750 shares.
The rise was fuelled by Standard Chartered Bank, which rose 170 cedis to 5,000 cedis.

Other gainers were Accra Brewery Limited ABL.GH., up seven cedis to 615, Pionneer Tobacco Company, up five to 250 cedis and Guinness Ghana Limited, up one to 358 cedis). The only loser was Aluminium Works which fell 15 cedis to 1,200 cedis.
Bids were far ahead of offers by 1,542,550 to 292,890.
